contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=February 2013}} {{Taxobox | name = Uroplatus fimbriatus | image = Uroplatus fimbriatus2.JPG | status = LC | status_system = iucn3.1 | status_ref = <ref>[http://www.iucnredlist.org/apps/redlist/details/172939/0 IUCN Red List], retrieved 16 February 2012</ref> | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordate|Chordata]] | classis = [[Reptile|Reptilia]] | ordo = [[Squamata]] | familia = [[Gekkonidae]] | genus = ''[[Uroplatus]]'' | species = '''''U. fimbriatus''''' | binomial = ''Uroplatus fimbriatus'' | binomial_authority = [[Johann Gottlob Schneider|Schneider]], 1797 | range_map = Uroplatus fimbriatus distribution.png }} '''''Uroplatus fimbriatus''''' is a [[gecko]] which is found in eastern [[Madagascar]] and on the islands [[Nosy Bohara]] and [[Nosy Mangabe]]. These geckos live in tropical rain forests. They reach a total length of 330 mm. A large nocturnal gecko, by day it plasters itself to a small tree trunk and rests head down. If disturbed it will raise its tail and head, open its mouth and scream.<ref name="Glaw1">{{cite book | last = Glaw| first = F.| coauthors = Vences, M. | title = A Fieldguide to the Amphibians and Reptiles of Madagascar| publisher = Vences & Glaw Verlag| year =1994 | location =Köln | pages =313 | isbn =3-929449-00-5 }}</ref> ==Etymology== The [[Genus|generic]] name, ''[[Uroplatus]]'', is a [[Latin]]ization of two [[Ancient Greek|Greek]] words: "ourá" (οὐρά) meaning "tail" and "platys" (πλατύς) meaning "flat". Its [[species|specific]] name ''fimbriatus'' is the Latin word for "fringed" based upon the gecko's unique appearance of fringed skin. ==Threats== Habitat destruction and deforestation in Madagascar is the primary threat to this animal's future as well as collection for the pet trade.<ref name="CITES">{{cite web | title = Inclusion of Uroplatus spp. in Appendix II | work = Technical comments in support of amendments to CITES appendices submitted by Madagascar| publisher = CITES| year =2004 | url = http://www.cites.org/common/cop/13/inf/E13i-32.pdf| format = pdf | doi = | accessdate = 2 November 2008 }}</ref> The [[World Wide Fund for Nature]] (WWF) lists all of the ''Uroplatus'' species on their "Top ten most wanted species list" of animals threatened by illegal [[wildlife trade]], because of it "being captured and sold at alarming rates for the international pet trade". It is a [[CITES]] Appendix 2 protected animal.<ref name="CITES"/> ==Gallery== <gallery> Image:UroplatusFimbriatus.JPG|Giant Leaftail Gecko image:Leaf Tailed Gecko P9240101.JPG|Leaf Tailed Gecko image:Leaf Tailed Gecko P9240102.JPG|Leaf Tailed Gecko - from below File:Uroplatus fimbriatus (3).jpg|The underside of the Leaf Tailed Gecko clinging to [[glass]] </gallery> ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Endemic fauna of Madagascar]] [[Category:Flat-tailed geckos]] [[Category:Reptiles of Africa]]
